title: Don Quixote
description: The story of the gentle knight and his servant Sancho Panza has entranced readers for centuries.

title: Pilgrim's Progress
description: The one with the Slough of Despond and Vanity Fair.

title: Gulliver's Travels
description: A wonderful satire that still works for all ages, despite the savagery of Swift's vision.

title: Tom Jones
description: The adventures of a high-spirited orphan boy: an unbeatable plot.

title: Clarissa
description: One of the longest novels in the English language, but unputdownable.

title: The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman
description: One of the first bestsellers, dismissed by Dr Johnson as too fashionable for its own good.

title: Dangerous Liaisons
description: An epistolary novel and a handbook for seducers: foppish, French, and ferocious.

title: Emma
description: Near impossible choice between this and Pride and Prejudice. But Emma never fails to fascinate and annoy.

title: Frankenstein
description: Inspired by spending too much time with Shelley and Byron.
